item.title: Marvel Rivals Trick Makes Captain America Way Deadlier
item.description:
Summary

  • Cancel attack animation by sprinting boosts Captain America's power in Marvel Rivals.
  • Developers hint at new heroes and cosmetics, while fans uncover hidden mechanics.
  • Utilize the sprint trick for effective damage output, but players are wary of it being patched.

A Marvel Rivals fan has come up with a brilliant strategy involving canceling an attack animation by sprinting, which makes Captain America far more powerful. While Captain America is one of the most popular characters in the MCU, he hasn't been as widely used as some of the other characters in Marvel Rivals .

Marvel Rivals has quickly established itself as one of the most popular hero shooters available. Since its launch, Marvel Rivals has shattered several records and it shows no sign of stopping. The developers seem to have some exciting stuff in store for fans as well. For instance, a leak revealed that three new heroes could be coming to Marvel Rivals in the near future. Alongside that, plenty of different cosmetics have made their way into the game in the past few days. Meanwhile, fans are still searching for hidden mechanics they can exploit, and one such player has found a brilliant strategy for Captain America.

In a new tweet, user AV2RY reveals an extremely powerful trick to make Captain America more effective in Marvel Rivals . If a player cancels their attacks while playing as Captain America, it makes him faster. This essentially translates to much higher damage output as well, as he will be able to deliver more melee attacks in the same amount of time. However, pulling off this trick might require a bit of work from the players.

How to Cancel Attacks With Captain America in Marvel Rivals

In order to pull this trick, players will need to first ensure that they turn off the "Hold to Dash" setting in Marvel Rivals . This is crucial, as without this players will need to hold the dash button to sprint, making this trick practically useless. Once that's done, players are all set to start canceling their attacks by sprinting. In short, all users need to do is simply cycle between attacking and sprinting to deal tons of damage in a short span of time. However, fans are a bit skeptical about this trick as it seems like something more of an exploit in Marvel Rivals than a feature, so they think it might be patched in the near future.

This trick makes Captain America a really great attacker as well, an area where he falters compared to some other tanks in Marvel Rivals . With a new season slated to release in Marvel Rivals soon, it remains to be seen if the developers actually patch this trick or if it becomes an integral part of the meta.

item.title: 5 Longest FPS Video Game Remakes, Ranked
item.description:
Video games have been a medium for decades at this point, spawning many legendary titles and franchises. As some of these games are quite old, some players might not have experienced them. These games also most likely have aspects of them that don't fit with the modern environment, the most obvious of which being graphics.

Remaking a game is a way to reintroduce an older video game to a modern audience, to the modern landscape, or both. And within the many genres, first-person shooters have always been insanely popular, with some titles indeed being decades old. However, some have been remade, sometimes received positively, sometimes received negatively, but nonetheless breathing new air into the series.

5 Counter-Strike: Source

A Game With A Time Length Dependent On The Player

The Counter-Strike series has seen its fair share of weird games, from Counter-Strike Nexon , to Counter-Strike NEO . Counter-Strike: Source was Valve's attempt at remaking the original Counter-Strike , despite being often remembered as its own standalone game nowadays, which makes sense given it took them over two decades to make a direct sequel to the original.

Counter-Strike Source's length is open-ended , as being a competitive multiplayer game, it technically doesn't have an ending. Players can play for as long as they want to, whether that's five hours, or thousands of hours. One can argue its length ended in 2012 when Counter-Strike: Global Offensive took over as the new game of the series, but even now, people can go back and continue playing CS: Source, given it doesn't have a conclusive ending.

4 Rise Of The Triad (2013)

7 Hours And 30 Minutes

Platform

PC

Released

2013-07-31

Developer

Interceptor Entertainment

Genre

First-person Shooter

Rise of the Triad has had some different versions of it released since its release in 1995. Recently, the Rise of the Triad: Ludicrous Edition was released, being a remaster of the original. However, the 2013 game, simply titled Rise of the Triad , was a remake of the original game, aiming to replicate the gameplay of the 1995 title.

The player is able to move at a fast speed, the level design is non-linear, and there are various weapons for use in fighting enemies. The game will take about seven hours to complete on average, while the additional side content can add on to this, increasing the time to eleven hours. For completionist players, the game can be a decent time sink, taking up to around thirty-eight hours to complete.

3 GoldenEye 007 (2010)

7 Hours And 30 Minutes

The James Bond series has seen its fair share of video game entries, going back decades at this point. Among them, the most legendary was the 1997 game, GoldenEye 007 for the Nintendo 64. Being such a beloved and legendary game, it would make sense for a remake to be created of it at some point.

In 2010, a remake of GoldenEye 007 was released, simply also named GoldenEye 007 , for the Wii and Nintendo DS. The remake has some changes to it compared to the original, such as the use of Daniel Craig as James Bond instead of Pierce Brosnan, but still allows players to play through areas of the film interactively. There are a different number of weapons for the player to use and progress through the game with. The game usually takes around seven hours to complete, while it can take sixteen hours when also indulging in the side content.

2 Black Mesa

15 Hours

Valve is one of the most legendary gaming companies to exist, finding success off of equally legendary games that have stood the test of time. Out of the different franchises they have created, Half-Life is the most well-known, being one of the most influential games ever. As a result, a remake of it would naturally come about sooner or later.

Named after the facility the game takes place in, Black Mesa is a remake of the original Half-Life, with stunning visuals as its immediate obvious feature. It is a very faithful remake of the first Half-Life, bringing the original areas, enemies, and weapons into a modern re-imagining that lives up to the legacy created by the original game. It isn't too long of an experience either, being around fifteen hours long when focusing on the main story, and around eighteen hours long when completing the side content. Its length might be a result of a remake of a game made in 1998, but that doesn't negate its viability, and anyone who enjoys the original, or is looking to get into the Half-Life series, should play Black Mesa .

1 System Shock (2023)

16 Hours

There were various games released in the 1990s that earned legendary status, and became some of the most influential games to be created, with System Shock being one such example. Released in 1994, it became a beloved game that is often talked about as a title that should be played when discussing the all-time greats.

As a result of such praise, it was a natural conclusion for a remake to be created. Released in 2023, the remake also garnered high praise, for keeping it in line with what made the original great, but also updating for the modern landscape. As it is a remake based on a game released in 1994, the length isn't as long compared to some modern video games, only taking around sixteen hours to complete it. However, the side content can increase this playtime up to around twenty-four hours, while for the completionist, it can take thirty-three hours, making for a good deluge of gameplay.

item.title: Hunt: Showdown 1896 – Best Legendary Hunters, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Crytek's Hunt: Showdown 1896 continues to succeed with new DLC, like Post Malone event hunters.
  • Legendary Hunter skins have unique designs, animation, and sometimes provide camouflage in-game.
  • DLCs like Frau Perchta, Scaramuccia, and more add unique and interesting characters to the game.

Crytek's under-the-radar release Hunt: Showdown 1896 continues to be quietly successful in the online gaming community. Years after its release, Crytek continues to maintain the game's unique PvPvE fusion with new DLCs, including skins, weapons, and more.

By far the most exciting of those updates are Hunter Skins, specifically Legendary Hunters. They have unique designs in both first-person and third-person, unique pre-game animations, and can occasionally provide additional camouflage in-game, depending on the colors in their outfit. Not every skin is created equal though.

Updated December 24, 2024, by Mehrdad Khayyat: Crytek never runs out of creative ideas to deliver new hunters, and Hunt Showdown: 1896 players know it pretty well. There is always something eye-catching that the devs have up their sleeve to deceive players for one last purchase.

Just recently, the Post Malone event arrived, and it does deliver one of the best every hunter in the game, especially for those who are already a Post Malone fan. But that's not all. 2024 has been a big year for Hunt Showdown: 1896 in any aspect.

13 Perchta: Dusk

Exclusive To Drau Perchta DLC

Eastern stories of the midwinter tell of a being that is neither woman nor beast who stalks the frigid hinterlands. She splits open the abdomens of her victims and leaves their entrails for the wild animals to feast on. Her name is Frau Perchta, and she is coming to Louisiana.

The Frau Perchta DLC technically comes with two Legendary Hunter skins, although they represent the same character. Perchta: Dawn and Perchta: Dusk both look about as cool as any player could hope for. Her mask is intimidating, and her clothes look fantastic. What elevates Perchta: Dusk is that, as one might expect, her color tone is significantly darker. Both her mask and her clothes move away from the whites of Perchta: Dawn into grays and blacks. It makes her much harder to spot, and therefore, much more dangerous.

12 Scaramuccia

Exclusive To Commedia Della Morte DLC

For a theater performer who has starred in many creepy shows, nothing could be more traumatic than having his shows turn into reality, but for Scaramuccia, this was indeed a wish. He has scared people many times on the scene for a few coins, but now he can scare real terrors for bags of gold.

Wearing a triple-face mask, Scaramuccia doesn't have anything short of the insane faces spotted in the corrupted towns. He has been training with fake monsters for so long that facing real nightmares does not seem to wake up the fear inside Scaramuccia.

11 Corvid: Brood

Available Through Blood Bonds

Corvid hunters were added to Hunt: Showdown 1896 following the popularity of the Plague Doctor, who was an event-specific hunter. Both Corvid skins wear headgears similar to that of Plague Doctor, though they come with their own unique identities.

Brood is the nickname for Emma Davies, a woman who deeply dissected the heart of infection to learn its nature, though this cost her a lot. Sacrificing her morality to discover the truth about the Corruption has led Emma to the frontline of the war against the plague.

10 Hex Breaker

Available Through Blood Bonds

Survived from the outbreak in New Orleans, Hex Breaker is too arrogant to bow against the Corruption and the darkness it has brought with it. Wearing a shiny leather coat, Hex Breaker gives as much attention to his style as he cares about doing his job perfectly.

Known as the "man of many names," Hex Breaker does have an evil side to his face, and he never tries to hide it. In fact, his evil smile does say something about his background, but for now, clearing the Corruption is the priority.

9 Captain Laffite

Exclusive To Law Of Salvage DLC

Finding the correct path in darkness is a natural skill for sailors like Captain Laffite. Many sailors have managed to lead their ships to their destination safe and sound, but only a few survived sunken ships. Captain Laffite knows best how to guide a sunken sailor towards their destiny.

With a flintlock pistol attached to his waist, Laffite is ready for anything. If he has been able to survive death once, he can repeat the same again and again. Laffite has a pretty unique appearance, which makes him a great candidate for piracy enthusiasts.

8 Luz Mala

Exclusive To La Luz Mala DLC

The skinny huntress has seen a lot in her hometown of Patagonia, and has changed forever since then. With white strips on her body and mask, Luz Mala is quite skillful when hiding behind the bushes and keeping her distance from her targets, especially in the dark.

Her African origin allows Luz Mala to be fast and agile while lingering in the shadows. She is one of the unique hunters in the game, who never reveals her face and never forgets the forces that destroyed Patagonia, leaving nothing behind but nightmares for her.

7 Silver Spur

Exclusive To Bones Of Bounties DLC

Hunt Showdown: 1896 has never had a cross-over with The Witcher series recently, but no one can deny how the similarities between Silver Spur and Geralt of Rivia. While this pale-haired hunter does not depict Geralt, his face is quite close to that of the master witcher.

In The Witcher franchise, Geralt's hair is pale white because of the challenging trials he went through to become a witcher, and in Hunt Showdown: 1896 , Silver Spur has pale hair because of a curse. And a curse is a magical effect. Could this all be a coincidence?

6 Ghost Face

Exclusive To Ghost Face Rampage DLC

Released as a part of the Halloween expansion, Ghost Face soon turned into an iconic face in Hunt Showdown: 1896 , mostly because of his familiar face, which is heavily inspired by the Scream movie series, another Halloween classic!

The mask is, of course, the most iconic part of the outfit for Ghost Face, and honestly, every player that witnesses that face in the dark will surely make a little jump from their seat. The helmet also helps the character to have a look that fits in the game's setting.

5 Hayali

Exclusive To When Shadows Dance DLC

Wearing a mask of two opposing faces, Hayali is a master of mischief and persuasion. He is one of the mysterious hunters with a vague background. And that's what makes him more interesting to players, to know that it is not easy to learn about the secrets behind that deceitful mask.

Hayali's spawn animation is also a representation of his mischievous manners, as he begins rising up just like a puppet, but then he shows his true self. This is also a reference to the fact that Hayali tries to control his enemies like a puppet, leading them to where he wants them to be.

4 The Miko

Exclusive To Shrine Maiden's Hell DLC

Bringing with her a sword that has lived in her family's shrine for generations, The Miko made the trek to Louisiana to silence the mouths that give her weapon a voice. What that means is anyone's guess, but what it means to players is that there's a creepy new Hunter stalking the bayou.

The Miko benefits most significantly from her shawl, which drapes in tatters over her shoulders. The rough nature of her clothes helps her blend in with the bayou's natural growth. However, as with many characters on this list, her brightly-colored mask will stick out in the dark recesses of the swamp, and her top knot just makes her head a bigger target.

3 The Reaper

Exclusive To Fear The Reaper DLC

Released alongside the Fear The Reaper DLC, The Reaper is a dark and imposing figure. His tightly wrapped dark grey cloak and the sickle at his waist invoke thoughts of the Grim Reaper himself, and the skull-like face mask he wears takes the intimidation factor to another level.

Visually, The Reaper is a home run. The struggles begin to appear in practice. His clock, while cinched around his waist, will billow around his feet. This added movement can make him stick out in a way that works against the strong camouflage offered by his color palette. Much like other entries on this list, while The Reaper's face mask is unquestionably scary, it also stands out against the background of the Bayou, making his head an easier target to spot than is ideal.

2 The Reptilian

Exclusive To Cold Blooded DLC

Released along with the Cold Blooded DLC pack, The Reptilian comes sporting some of the best natural camouflage in the entire game. Between his coloring, his face mask, and the texture of his cloak, when The Reptilian gets low, he looks just like any old rock or driftwood that litters the maps of Hunt: Showdown 1896.

The good news is that the Reptilian is more deadly than a rock. When positioned properly, opposing Hunters tend to stroll right past him without even noticing he's there, a mistake many won't recover from. He also just looks fantastic, especially when equipped with his signature Tooth To Tail Bomb Lance.

1 Post Malone: Deposed King/Ringmaster

Exclusive To Post Malone's Murder Circus Battle Pass

Post Malone is one of the well-known singers among gamers mostly because he is also an avid gamer. His love and passion for Hunt Showdown: 1896 is no secret, and now it's time to meet him as a playable hunter in-game with a dedicated event.

Represented as a circus runner, Post Malone's character is one of the best and most detailed hunters in the game, especially with those iconic tattoos beneath the eyes and the long beard. For every skin collector in the game, Post Malone is a must-have hunter.

item.title: Elden Ring Fans Are Obsessed With Zabito Boga
item.description:
Summary

  • Fans popularized "Zabito Boga" catchphrase on social media after it was featured in Elden Ring.
  • "Zabito Boga" means "God Slain" in Polish.
  • Elden Ring developers acknowledged "Zabito Boga" trend, akin to "Praise the Sun" from Dark Souls.

Elden Ring fans have become obsessed with a new catchphrase, "Zabito Boga," which has been making rounds on social media after a Polish player posted a screenshot of it in-game. In fact, the term has gotten so popular that even the Elden Ring developers acknowledged it in a hilarious way.

It's been a while since Elden Ring and the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC was released, but fans are making sure there is no dearth of new content in social media forums. From uncovering secrets to posting fan art and theories, Elden Ring players have shown their dedication to the game time and again. For instance, one Elden Ring recently found a creative way to defeat Margit, the first boss players encounter in the Lands Between. Meanwhile, it seems like the Soulsborne community has found their new favorite catchphrase.

A new term has been going viral on the Elden Ring subreddit and other forums on social media. It all started with a Polish player posting a picture of them defeating Radahn in Elden Ring , and it had the phrase "Zabito Boga" mentioned on the screen. While it was a totally normal screenshot, fans seem to have found the phrase quite catchy, and it instantly became viral on social media. Fans have been making all sorts of posts around the phrase, and it seems like it has become the new "Praise the Sun" for the Soulsborne community.

What Does Zabito Boga Mean?

​​​​​​​

While it has become extremely popular, "Zabito Boga" is just a simple translation of one of the most commonly seen phrases in the game. "Zabito Boga" is actually "God Slain" in Polish, which is the message that is shown on screen after players beat Radahn and several other bosses in Elden Ring . However, since the term is quite catchy, fans have been using it to wish each other "Zabito Boga," which is basically an Elden Ring way of greeting players who defeated Radahn and completed the game.

The developers haven't shied away from acknowledging this term either. Bandai Namco posted a tweet stating "ZABITO BOGA to all who celebrate." Fans are having an absolute field day with how quickly a joke became viral. That being said, the community has been privy to such instances in the past. The phrase "Praise the Sun" from Dark Souls not only became a sensation in the Soulsborne community but also the gaming industry as a whole. Not to forget, the iconic death screen from the Dark Souls games is also a well-known meme. With Elden Ring: Nightrein the next game on the radar, it will be interesting to see what other phrases the community comes up with.
